description: As Donald Trump’s sweeping “reciprocal” tariffs took effect just after midnight on Wednesday, the president was watching the bond market.
title: Bond Chaos, Deal Mania and Jamie Dimon: Inside Trump’s Tariff Reversal

description: About 4,000 employees at the US Department of Transportation are seeking to take a second buyout offer made available last week as part of a broader effort to curtail the size of the federal workforce, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: US DOT Sees 7% of Workers Aiming to Take Second Buyout Offer

description: A senior US immigration official said the Trump administration is looking to overhaul deportation logistics by modeling operations after delivery giants like Amazon and FedEx, as Immigration and Customs Enforcement struggles with court backlogs and crowded detention centers.
title: ICE Chief Says Deportation System Should Run Like Amazon Prime

description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order Wednesday to review the Pentagon’s weapons acquisition process, including assessments of top weapons programs that may be behind schedule and beset by cost overruns.
title: Trump Directs Review of All Major Defense Acquisition Programs

description: US President Donald Trump threatened to use military action against Iran if it were to try and acquire a nuclear weapon, as negotiators are set to meet Saturday to discuss the standoff over Tehran’s nuclear program.
title: Trump Says He’d Use Military to Prevent Iran From Nuclear Weapon

description: United States Steel Corp. shares tumbled as much as 16% in post-market trading after President Donald Trump said he does not want to see the steelmaker owned by a Japanese company.
title: US Steel Falls 16% After Trump Says He Doesn’t Want Japanese Owner

description: The US federal government’s central human resources office will begin deploying artificial intelligence to clean up its personnel records this year, marking the boldest public move yet into using the technology on sensitive records.
title: US Government Employs AI to Analyze Worker Personnel Files

description: Iraq signed non-binding agreements with two American companies to add 27 gigawatts to its power production capacity in an effort to address increasing demand for electricity.
title: Iraq Signs Agreements With US Companies to Expand Power Plants

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House editor Jordan Fabian looks at the latest twists in President Trump’s trade war. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Pauses Some Tariffs But Hits Fast-Forward for China

description: US Chief Justice John Roberts let President Donald Trump temporarily oust top officials at two independent agencies while the Supreme Court decides how to handle a new showdown over presidential power.
title: Chief Justice Lets Trump Remove Two Top Agency Officials for Now

description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order Wednesday that seeks to revive US shipbuilding and will dispatch Elon Musk’s efficiency squad to investigate how the US Navy fell so far behind in turning out vessels.
title: Trump Signs Order to Revive US Shipbuilding, DOGE Review of Navy

description: President Donald Trump’s sudden change to tariff policy on Wednesday won’t affect the rates that currently apply Canadian and Mexican products, according to a White House official.
title: Canada, Mexico Tariffs Are Left Unchanged by Trump Trade Shift

description: The social media post landed at 9:37 a.m. in New York.
title: Trump Said Today Was a ‘Great Time to Buy.’ He Was Right

description: The dirtiest coal-fired power plant in the US and dozens of others are being exempted from stringent air pollution mandates as part of US President Donald Trump’s bid to revitalize the industry.
title: Trump Exempts Dirtiest Coal Power Plant From Pollution Rules

description: US President Donald Trump’s decision to pause on higher tariffs is the “beginning of a return to economic reason and a bit of realism,” according European Central Bank Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau.
title: ECB’s Villeroy Salutes Trump’s Step Toward ‘Economic Reason’

description: The murmurs spread quietly at first, then exploded into a roar as the news hit — President Donald Trump was pausing the bulk of his tariffs and putting his global trade war on hold. Mostly.
title: ‘Is It Real?!’ NYSE Trading Floor Erupts as Trump Pauses Tariffs

description: The US is determined to eliminate China’s “malign influence” over the Panama Canal as part of the effort to “make the Americas great again,” Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said Wednesday in Panama City.
title: US Seeks to End China's Influence Over Panama Canal, Hegseth Says

description: France’s finance minister Eric Lombard cut the government’s growth forecast as a global trade war triggered by US President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs dimmed the outlook.
title: France Cuts Growth Forecast as Trump Tariffs Weigh

description: The US attorney’s office in the District of Utah unsealed charges against four citizens accused of participating in a failed coup attempt in Democratic Republic of Congo last year.
title: US Unseals Charges Against Four Americans in Congo Coup Attempt

description: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said the nation is willing to buy the next tranche of military assistance from the US while it still awaits a reply from the White House on the prospects of it sending vital future war-aid lifelines.
title: Zelenskiy Says Ukraine Is Ready to Pay for New War Aid From US

description: President Donald Trump asked the US Supreme Court to let him immediately fire top officials at two independent agencies, filing an emergency request in a case that could bolster White House control over federal regulators.
title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Let Him Fire Top Agency Officials

description: A federal appeals court on Wednesday freed the Trump administration to fire thousands of federal employees at 20 US agencies, lifting a lower court order that had blocked the mass terminations.
title: Appeals Court Clears Trump to Enforce Firings at 20 Agencies

description: President Donald Trump said he would pause higher reciprocal tariffs for 90 days on dozens of trade partners, while raising duties on China to 125%.
title: Trump Pauses Higher Duties on Most Nations, Hikes China Rate

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Kyiv’s intelligence services identified at least 155 Chinese nationals fighting alongside Moscow’s troops following a Russian recruitment drive on social media.
title: Zelenskiy Says Beijing Knows Moscow Recruiting Chinese

description: Tanzanian police arrested the east African nation’s main opposition leader after he addressed a rally to promote democratic reform ahead of October elections, his party said.
title: Tanzanian Police Arrest Main Opposition Leader, Party Says

description: Democratic Senator Ron Wyden said he intends to delay the confirmation of the newest head of the government’s cyber watchdog until the agency releases a report on cybersecurity issues plaguing the telecommunications sector.
title: Senator Wyden Moves to Delay Cyber Nominee Over Telecom Breaches

description: House Republicans plan to move Wednesday to prevent Democrats from forcing them to take a public vote on President Donald Trump’s global tariffs, a person familiar said.
title: House Republicans Move to Block Vote on Repealing Trump Tariffs

description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said she doesn’t plan to use a get-out clause to override her fiscal rules, even as US President Donald Trump’s tariff war roiled global markets, forcing down the pound and UK gilts.
title: Reeves Rejects Using Fiscal Rules Escape Clause Over Tariff War

description: Slovakia moved a step closer to changing its constitution in a way that could further curb the standing of gay and trans-gender people.
title: Slovakia Seeks to Further Curb LGBTQ Rights in Child Adoptions

description: The Trump administration’s bid to deport alleged Venezuelan gang members was temporarily blocked by judges in New York and Texas, in a pair of cases over the president’s use of a two-century old wartime law.
title: Venezuelan Deportations Temporarily Blocked by NY, Texas Judges

description: An unraveling of the US-China trade relationship would be ‘disastrous,’ Yellen once warned
title: Trump Shock Pushes US and China Toward Decoupling Cliff Edge

description: Amazon.com Inc. has canceled orders for multiple products made in China and other Asian countries, according to a document reviewed by Bloomberg and people familiar with the matter, suggesting the company is reducing its exposure to tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump.
title: Amazon Cancels Some Inventory Orders From China After Tariffs

description: Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins said the administration is considering plans to offer assistance to farmers amid worries that the US-China trade war will have a disastrous effect on American agricultural producers.
title: US Weighs Farmer Bailout as China Retaliation Threatens Exports

description: Premier Giorgia Meloni will lay out plans suggesting Italy’s deficit could potentially get below the European Union’s 3% deficit ceiling next year, even with the economy growing less than forecast, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Meloni Deficit Plans Seen on Track Despite Italy’s Growth Hit

description: President Donald Trump urged Americans to remain calm and continue investing on Wednesday as his sweeping reciprocal tariffs hit, in an indication the White House was closely monitoring market reaction to the levies.
title: Trump Says ‘Be Cool’ After Tariffs, Adds ‘Great Time to Buy’

description: The European Union approved tariffs to hit around €21 billion ($23.2 billion) of US goods in retaliation for the 25% duties President Donald Trump imposed last month on the bloc’s steel and aluminum exports.
title: EU Adopts Tariffs on €21 Billion of US Goods in Metals Fight

description: Terrorist group al-Shabaab is expanding territory across Somalia and increasingly working with Iran-backed Houthi militants in Yemen to disrupt Red Sea trade, in a stunning revival of an insurgency that the US has spent billions of dollars fighting.
title: Somali Terror Group Consolidates Power, Builds Ties to Houthis

description: France’s government will aim for extra savings in this year’s finance plan as it cancels or reallocates €5 billion ($5.5 billion) of reserve credits, Budget Minister Amelie de Montchalin said Wednesday.
title: France Seeks Extra Spending Cuts as Budget Plan Under Pressure

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent played down a selloff in US Treasuries, saying that there was nothing systemic at play, and also served warning against China not to attempt to devalue its exchange rate in retaliation for American tariff hikes.
title: Bessent Sees ‘Normal Deleveraging’ in Bonds, Warns China on Yuan

description: In his haste, Elon Musk is pushing out thousands of the government’s best minds.
title: Trump Is Firing the Wrong People, on Purpose

description: The European Union and the US discussed “parameters of possible engagement” to address the trade dispute triggered by US President Donald Trump, according to a European Commission spokesperson.
title: EU Trade Chief Discussed Parameters to Lower Tariffs With US

description: Friedrich Merz’s conservatives and the Social Democrats sealed an agreement to form Germany’s next government, paving the way for Merz to take over as chancellor as soon as the first week of May.
title: German Conservative Merz’s New Cabinet: Meet the Key Members

description: China retaliated to new tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump, announcing it would raise duties on US goods to 84%, deepening a trade war between the world’s largest economies.
title: China Raises Tariffs on US Goods to 84% as Trade Rift Worsens

description: The Indian government has approved the purchase of 26 Rafale marine fighter jets, boosting the South Asian nation’s defense credentials at a time it is presenting itself as a bulwark against China in the Indian Ocean region.
title: India Approves $7.4 Billion Deal to Buy 26 French Fighter Jets

description: President Donald Trump has ramped up US tariffs on China by a record 104%, betting he can force Xi Jinping to the table even as Beijing vows to “fight until the end.” The question now is which leader folds first.
title: Trump-Xi Standoff Upends Global Trade With Neither Side Budging

description: A new hub for defense companies focused on key items like munitions and solid rocket motors is under development in the Midwest, as the Pentagon looks to broaden the US defense industrial base.
title: Hub in Indiana Seeks to Broaden the Pentagon’s Industrial Base

description: China will be a hard habit to kick even for a US president seemingly bent on obliterating all of its imports.
title: Badger Hair and iPhones: Where US-China Decoupling Is Hardest

description: Lego A/S is undaunted by the wave of new tariffs President Donald Trump unleashed on US trading partners as the world’s largest toymaker opened a new production complex in Vietnam.
title: Lego Opens New Vietnam Plant as US Tariffs Hit Global Markets

description: Three US citizens jailed in the Democratic Republic of Congo after a failed coup were released to their home country after the intervention of Qatar, according to a diplomat with knowledge of the matter.
title: Congo Transfers Jailed US Citizens After Qatar’s Intervention

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump’s Tariffs Push Europe Closer to China

description: Germany’s conservatives and Social Democrats reached an agreement to form a ruling coalition, paving the way for Friedrich Merz to become chancellor at a time of acute domestic and geopolitical turmoil.
title: Germany’s Merz Seals Deal With SPD to Form Ruling Coalition

description: Iran’s President Masoud Pezeshkian said his country will provide “any necessary guarantees” that it doesn’t want to develop nuclear weapons as it prepares for talks with the US this weekend.
title: Iran Vows to Never Pursue Nuclear Weapons Ahead of Talks With US

description: Bucharest Mayor Nicusor Dan clinched the backing of a Romanian opposition party for next month’s presidential election, in a boost for the pro-European candidate who’s seen as having the best shot against the poll-leading nationalist politician.
title: Bucharest Mayor Wins Opposition Party’s Support for Romania Vote

description: President Prabowo Subianto met the leader of Indonesia’s de facto opposition party for the first time in more than a year, looking to reassure investors as a US tariff threat hung over Southeast Asia’s largest economy.
title: Prabowo Courts Political Rival Megawati as US Tariffs Add to Indonesia’s Worries

description: South Korea’s presidential election swung into action after the leader of the opposition party and frontrunner Lee Jae-myung indicated his intention to run in what is expected to be another tight race.
title: South Korean Presidential Race in Top Gear as Frontrunner Joins

description: India’s strategy to counter the US’s damaging tariffs is to finalize a trade agreement with President Donald Trump’s government, Foreign Minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar said.
title: India Tariff Strategy Is to Seek US Trade Deal, Jaishankar Says

description: European allies are urging the US to coordinate on any plans to reduce its military presence on the continent to avoid destabilizing NATO defenses, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: European Allies Appeal to US to Avert a Shock Troop Reduction

description: Trump administration officials have described the men deported to El Salvador prisons last month as “the worst of the worst,” suggesting they were gang members involved in murder, rape and kidnapping.
title: About 90% of Migrants Sent to Salvador Lacked US Criminal Record

description: Thailand’s parliament held an urgent debate on the fallout of the 36% US levy on the country’s exports as lawmakers expressed concern about the long-term impact of the tariff on the trade-reliant nation’s economy.
title: Thai Parliament Holds Urgent Debate as US Tariff Takes Effect

description: Beijing lashed out at US Vice President JD Vance for comments he made about “Chinese peasants,” adding a personal dimension to the tensions between the world’s biggest economies just as a global trade war unfolds.
title: Vance’s ‘Chinese Peasants’ Remarks Get Sharp Rebuke From Beijing

description: Asian governments from South Korea to Indonesia are rushing to sign up for liquefied natural gas purchases from the US, hoping to reduce trade surpluses with the world’s largest economy and secure some relief from President Donald Trump’s sweeping “reciprocal” tariffs.
title: Asian Nations Promise to Buy More US Gas to Win Tariff Relief

description: South Korea is seeking to cut a “big” trade deal with the US after a last-minute phone call between Donald Trump and Acting President Han Duck-soo raised the prospects of bringing some relief to the export-reliant nation hit hard by tariffs blitz.
title: South Korea Eyes ‘Big’ Trade Deal After Long Awaited Trump Call

description: China hasn’t immediately responded to the new US tariffs, a departure from the last two episodes when President Donald Trump hiked duties and Beijing hit back within minutes.
title: China Holds Fire on Immediate Retaliation Against New US Tariffs

description: Ray Dalio warned that investors are too narrowly fixated on tariffs and not paying enough attention to the bigger “once-in-a-lifetime” breakdown occurring in major monetary, political and geopolitical orders.
title: Dalio Sees Once-a-Lifetime Collapse in Economic, Political Order

description: President Donald Trump’s so-called reciprocal tariffs are now in place, dealing a thunderous blow to the world economy as he pushes forward efforts to drastically reorder global trade.
title: Trump Tariffs Take Effect Hiking Trade Levies to a 100-Year High

description: Friedrich Merz’s conservatives and the Social Democrats appear close to a coalition agreement to form Germany’s next government, with an announcement possibly coming later on Wednesday, paving the way for Merz to take over as chancellor.
title: Merz’s German Cabinet Starts to Take Shape: Possible Key Members

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is used to weathering storms over almost three decades in and out of power — and is starting to flex his muscles again after a recent run of adversity.
title: Netanyahu Tightens Control in Israel With Trump Back in Power

description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez’s trip to see President Xi Jinping will offer a chance to swap notes on a common problem: how to respond to an increasingly unreliable US.
title: Spain Is Pushing for EU Pivot to China to Counter Trump Tariffs

description: President Donald Trump said his long-promised tariffs on pharmaceutical drugs will be coming soon, the latest signal that he plans to press ahead with more sectoral tariffs despite market fallout from his global levies.
title: Trump Says Long-Promised Pharmaceutical Tariffs Due Very Shortly

description: Japan has sent two senior government officials to the US to lay the groundwork for upcoming tariff negotiations by top representatives, according to two government officials familiar with the matter.
title: Japan Sends Senior Officials to US to Prepare for Tariff Talks

description: President Donald Trump cast his tariffs as a political winner in an attempt to assuage fears from wealthy Republican benefactors about the fallout of his signature trade policy just hours before even more sweeping tariffs were due to take effect.
title: Trump Woos Political Donors as Tariff Worries Rattle Republicans

description: John Cornyn
title: Texas Senator John Cornyn Gets Primary Challenge From Ken Paxton

description: Northwestern and Cornell are the latest elite universities to have federal grants frozen by the Trump administration, following similar moves against Columbia and Princeton.
title: Cornell, Northwestern Get Hit With Federal Funding Freeze

description: Argentina reached an agreement with International Monetary Fund staff, a major step before the lender officially votes on a new $20 billion deal for the crisis-prone nation.
title: Milei Nears $20 Billion Argentina Loan as IMF Staff Sign Off

description: President Donald Trump’s administration on Tuesday elevated El Salvador’s travel safety designation to the best possible, putting it above countries in Western Europe, before President Nayib Bukele’s visit to the White House next week.
title: El Salvador Is Now Viewed as Safer to Visit Than France by the US

description: The Asian Development Bank will lower its growth forecast for Asia further after the region was hit the hardest by tariffs from the US.
title: US Tariffs to Significantly Impact Economies in Asia, ADB Says
